paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive File Formats
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive converting between different file formats
**File locations:** hostname:/tmp/dc hdfs://data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv
**Successful outcome:** Understanding of Hive file formats for CSV, ORC, Parquet, and Avro
**Before you begin:**
**Related lessons:** Hive File Formats

---

msg.data:
About

Lab: Hive File Formats
Objective: Become familiar with using Hive converting between different file formats
File locations: hostname:/tmp/dc hdfs://data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv
Successful outcome: Understanding of Hive file formats for CSV, ORC, Parquet, and Avro
Before you begin:
Related lessons: Hive File Formats

paragraphs.title: Get the data from github
List the file
Store the data into HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/dc
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir /data/dc
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -put /tmp/dc-wikia-data.csv /data/dc

paragraphs.title: Grant Hive and Zeppelin access to /data/dc
List the content of HDFS /data/dc

paragraphs.text:
%md
####Recommendation
The recommended practice is to set a policy in Ranger granting access to these users in all directories below /data

msg.data:
Recommendation

The recommended practice is to set a policy in Ranger granting access to these users in all directories below /data

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Lab
- For this Lab we will use Hive Interactive query.
- Prefix all queries with %jdbc(hive_interactive)

msg.data:
Lab

  • For this Lab we will use Hive Interactive query.
  • Prefix all queries with %jdbc(hive_interactive)

paragraphs.text:
%md

#### Hive external table with data stored using the CSV format

We are going to create an exterrnal staging table that will used CSV format.

~~~console
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dc_comics_stage ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/dc_comics_stage/' ;
~~~

The important lines for dealing with text data are:
  ROW FORMAT DELIMITED - This line tells the CREATE statement that a field delimiter must be declaired.
  FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' - This line tells the CREATE statement the field separator to be found in the text file.
Any character may be declaired as a field separator. Common field separators include:  " ", "\t", ":"

msg.data:
Hive external table with data stored using the CSV format

We are going to create an exterrnal staging table that will used CSV format.

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dc_comics_stage ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/dc_comics_stage/' ;

The important lines for dealing with text data are:
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED - This line tells the CREATE statement that a field delimiter must be declaired.
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' - This line tells the CREATE statement the field separator to be found in the text file.
Any character may be declaired as a field separator. Common field separators include: " “, “\t”, “:”

paragraphs.title: 1 - Drop the dc_comics_stage table if it exists

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 2 - Create the table dc_comics_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dc_comics_stage ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/dc_comics_stage/';

paragraphs.title: 3 - Load the dc comic data (/data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv) in the staging table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
LOAD DATA INPATH '/data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE dc_comics_stage;

paragraphs.text:
%md
Next we are going to create the ORC data format table

~~~console
CREATE TABLE dc_comics ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        )  
STORED AS ORC 
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

INSERT INTO TABLE dc_comics SELECT * FROM dc_comics_stage;

paragraphs.title: 9 - Add the csv file and remove the parquet file, if it is present
paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/dc/dc-wikia-data.parquet
hdfs dfs -put /tmp/dc-wikia-data.csv /data/dc
hdfs dfs -ls /data/dc

paragraphs.title: 10 - Use Spark to convert the data in a parquet file
paragraphs.text:
%spark

val df = spark.read.format("csv").option("header", "true").load("/data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv")
val df_new = df.select((col("page_id")),
                       (col("name")),
                       (col("urlslug")),
                       (col("ID")),
                       (col("ALIGN")),
                       (col("EYE")),
                       (col("HAIR")),
                       (col("SEX")),
                       (col("GSM")),
                       (col("APPEARANCES")),
                       (col("FIRST APPEARANCE").alias("FA")),
                       (col("YEAR")))
df_new.write.mode("overwrite").parquet("/data/dc/dc-wikia-data.parquet")

msg.data:
df: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [page_id: string, name: string ... 11 more fields]
df_new: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [page_id: string, name: string ... 10 more fields]

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Hive table with data stored in parquet formet

We are going to create a table where data is stored in parquet format.

~~~console
CREATE TABLE dc_comics_parquet( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
STORED AS Parquet;

~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 16 - List the directory /tmp/avro
17 - Move the Avro data into HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/avro
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir /data/avro
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -put /var/local/bin/avro/* /data/avro

msg.data: rm: `/data/avro': No such file or directory

-rw-r--r--   3 hdfs hdfs        288 2020-12-10 05:01 /data/avro/sample.avsc

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Hive table with data stored using avro schema
We are going to create a table with avro servde and avro schema.
The avro-tools utility can be used to generate the avro schema or sample.avsc

~~~
CREATE TABLE sample_table

ROW FORMAT
SERDE 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.avro.AvroSerDe'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES (
    'avro.schema.url'='hdfs:///labs/data/sample.avsc')

STORED AS
INPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerInputFormat'
OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerOutputFormat';

~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

msg.data:
Hive table with data stored using avro schema

We are going to create a table with avro servde and avro schema.
The avro-tools utility can be used to generate the avro schema or sample.avsc

CREATE TABLE sample_table

ROW FORMAT
SERDE 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.avro.AvroSerDe'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES (
    'avro.schema.url'='hdfs:///labs/data/sample.avsc')

STORED AS
INPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerInputFormat'
OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerOutputFormat';

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 19 - Drop the Avro table sample_table if it exists

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 20 - Create the Avro table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
CREATE TABLE sample_table

ROW FORMAT
SERDE 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.avro.AvroSerDe'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES (
    'avro.schema.url'='hdfs:////data/avro/sample.avsc')
    
STORED AS
INPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerInputFormat'
OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerOutputFormat';

paragraphs.title: 9 - Add the csv file and remove the parquet file, if it is present
10 - Use Spark to convert the data in a parquet file
paragraphs.text:
%spark

val df = spark.read.format("csv").option("header", "true").load("/data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv")
val df_new = df.select((col("page_id")),
                       (col("name")),
                       (col("urlslug")),
                       (col("ID")),
                       (col("ALIGN")),
                       (col("EYE")),
                       (col("HAIR")),
                       (col("SEX")),
                       (col("GSM")),
                       (col("APPEARANCES")),
                       (col("FIRST APPEARANCE").alias("FA")),
                       (col("YEAR")))
df_new.write.mode("overwrite").parquet("/data/dc/dc-wikia-data.parquet")
